Reshape CI between wide/long formats

Source: R/reshape_ci.R
reshape_ci.Rd

Reshape CI between wide/long formats.

reshape_ci(x)

Arguments

x

A data.frame containing CI_low and CI_high.

Examples

library(bayestestR)

x <- data.frame(replicate(4, rnorm(100)))
x <- ci(x, ci = c(0.68, 0.89, 0.95))
reshape_ci(x)
#>   Parameter  CI_low_68 CI_high_68 CI_low_89 CI_high_89 CI_low_95 CI_high_95
#> 1        X1 -0.9147131  1.1527286 -1.428172   1.678310 -1.920490   1.857787
#> 2        X2 -0.9238056  0.8484002 -1.501843   1.396094 -1.914717   1.632681
#> 3        X3 -1.1429470  0.8620997 -1.721403   1.469764 -2.007214   1.669133
#> 4        X4 -0.8918558  0.9918266 -1.562957   1.420475 -2.060722   1.533657
reshape_ci(reshape_ci(x))
#>    Parameter CI     CI_low   CI_high
#> 1         X1 68 -0.9147131 1.1527286
#> 2         X1 89 -1.4281724 1.6783100
#> 3         X1 95 -1.9204899 1.8577869
#> 4         X2 68 -0.9238056 0.8484002
#> 5         X2 89 -1.5018426 1.3960942
#> 6         X2 95 -1.9147167 1.6326812
#> 7         X3 68 -1.1429470 0.8620997
#> 8         X3 89 -1.7214030 1.4697638
#> 9         X3 95 -2.0072142 1.6691327
#> 10        X4 68 -0.8918558 0.9918266
#> 11        X4 89 -1.5629571 1.4204754
#> 12        X4 95 -2.0607225 1.5336565

x <- data.frame(replicate(4, rnorm(100)))
x <- describe_posterior(x, ci = c(0.68, 0.89, 0.95))
reshape_ci(x)
#>   Parameter       Median CI_low_95 CI_high_95  CI_low_68 CI_high_68 CI_low_89
#> 1        X1  0.030748428 -1.187347   2.075186 -0.9785711  0.7322157 -1.120350
#> 2        X2  0.081653534 -1.714925   2.007148 -0.7383368  1.0203381 -1.046694
#> 3        X3 -0.001736186 -2.152480   2.199777 -1.0853062  0.9160187 -1.770312
#> 4        X4  0.057515160 -1.862581   1.815215 -1.4530430  0.5943032 -1.689294
#>   CI_high_89   pd ROPE_CI ROPE_low ROPE_high ROPE_Percentage
#> 1   1.568570 0.52      89     -0.1       0.1      0.08888889
#> 2   2.007148 0.55      89     -0.1       0.1      0.10000000
#> 3   1.890036 0.50      89     -0.1       0.1      0.11111111
#> 4   1.433365 0.51      89     -0.1       0.1      0.10000000
reshape_ci(reshape_ci(x))
#>    Parameter       Median CI     CI_low   CI_high   pd ROPE_CI ROPE_low
#> 1         X1  0.030748428 68 -0.9785711 0.7322157 0.52      89     -0.1
#> 2         X1  0.030748428 89 -1.1203497 1.5685698 0.52      89     -0.1
#> 3         X1  0.030748428 95 -1.1873473 2.0751856 0.52      89     -0.1
#> 4         X2  0.081653534 68 -0.7383368 1.0203381 0.55      89     -0.1
#> 5         X2  0.081653534 89 -1.0466944 2.0071477 0.55      89     -0.1
#> 6         X2  0.081653534 95 -1.7149248 2.0071477 0.55      89     -0.1
#> 7         X3 -0.001736186 68 -1.0853062 0.9160187 0.50      89     -0.1
#> 8         X3 -0.001736186 89 -1.7703119 1.8900358 0.50      89     -0.1
#> 9         X3 -0.001736186 95 -2.1524798 2.1997766 0.50      89     -0.1
#> 10        X4  0.057515160 68 -1.4530430 0.5943032 0.51      89     -0.1
#> 11        X4  0.057515160 89 -1.6892938 1.4333652 0.51      89     -0.1
#> 12        X4  0.057515160 95 -1.8625814 1.8152150 0.51      89     -0.1
#>    ROPE_high ROPE_Percentage
#> 1        0.1      0.08888889
#> 2        0.1      0.08888889
#> 3        0.1      0.08888889
#> 4        0.1      0.10000000
#> 5        0.1      0.10000000
#> 6        0.1      0.10000000
#> 7        0.1      0.11111111
#> 8        0.1      0.11111111
#> 9        0.1      0.11111111
#> 10       0.1      0.10000000
#> 11       0.1      0.10000000
#> 12       0.1      0.10000000
